title: Static Analysis

android.permission.WAKE_LOCK.description: Allows an application to prevent the phone from going to sleep.

android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAG.description: Allows an application to write to external storage.

android.permission.INTERNET.description: Allows an application to create network sockets.

android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE.description: Allows an application to view the status of all networks.

android.permission.VIBRATE.description: Allows the application to control the vibrator.

certificate_findings: Application is signed with a code signing certificate

Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android 5.0-8.0, if signed only with v1 signature scheme. Applications running on Android 5.0-7.0 signed with v1, and v2/v3 scheme is also vulnerable.

manifest_analysis.title:
Application Data can be Backed up
[android:allowBackup] flag is missing.
manifest_analysis.desc: The flag [android:allowBackup] should be set to false. By default it is set to true and allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.
manifest_analysis.name: Application Data can be Backed up [android:allowBackup] flag is missing.

manifest_analysis.title:
Content Provider (MyPGNProvider) is not Protected.
[[Content Provider, targetSdkVersion < 17]
manifest_analysis.desc: A Content Provider is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. It is a Content Provider that targets an API level under 17, which makes it exported by default, regardless of the API level of the system that the application runs on.

nx.description: The shared object has NX bit set. This marks a memory page non-executable making attacker injected shellcode non-executable.

stack_canary.description: This shared object has a stack canary value added to the stack so that it will be overwritten by a stack buffer that overflows the return address. This allows detection of overflows by verifying the integrity of the canary before function return.

relocation_readonly.description: This shared object has full RELRO enabled. RELRO ensures that the GOT cannot be overwritten in vulnerable ELF binaries. In Full RELRO, the entire GOT (.got and .got.plt both) is marked as read-only.

rpath.description: The shared object does not have run-time search path or RPATH set.

runpath.description: The shared object does not have RUNPATH set.

fortify.description: The shared object does not have any fortified functions. Fortified functions provides buffer overflow checks against glibc's commons insecure functions like strcpy, gets etc. Use the compiler option -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 to fortify functions.

metadata.cwe: CWE-532: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File
metadata.description: The App logs information. Sensitive information should never be logged.
App can read/write to External Storage. Any App can read data written to External Storage.

metadata.cwe: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
metadata.description: App uses SQLite Database and execute raw SQL query. Untrusted user input in raw SQL queries can cause SQL Injection. Also sensitive information should be encrypted and written to the database.

metadata.cwe: CWE-312: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
metadata.description: Files may contain hardcoded sensitive information like usernames, passwords, keys etc.

FCS_STO_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not store any credentials to non-volatile memory.

FCS_CKM_EXT.1.1.choice: The application generate no asymmetric cryptographic keys.

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has access to ['network connectivity'].

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.2.choice: The application has access to no sensitive information repositories.

FDP_NET_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has user/application initiated network communications.

FDP_DAR_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not encrypt files in non-volatile memory.

FMT_MEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application invoke the mechanisms recommended by the platform vendor for storing and setting configuration options.

FTP_DIT_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not encrypt any data in traffic or does not transmit any data between itself and another trusted IT product.

strings:
"ics_offers_abort" : "Your opponent would like to abort the game.
Do you wish to accept?"
"pref_pieceset_desc" : "The kind of piece set to display"
"pref_showLastMove_desc" : "Shows the last move with higlighted squares"

"ics_offers_takeback" : "Your opponent would like to take back a move.
Do you wish to accept?"
"pgntool_delete_explanation" : "Delete all games in the game database"
"pgntool_confirm_practice_reset" : "Are you sure you want to reset?"

"ics_offers_draw" : "Your opponent offers you a draw.
Do you wish to accept?"
"ics_error_connection" : "Could not connect to server. Make sure you have your internet connection enabled"
"pref_puzzle_show_seekbar_desc" : "Quickly navigate through puzzles with seek bar"

"ics_offers_adjourn" : "Your opponent would like to adjourn the game.
Do you wish to accept?"
"err_sd_not_mounted" : "In order to process your request, your SD-card needs to be mounted."
"err_load_fen" : "FEN chess position could not be loaded"
"err_no_clip_text" : "There is no text on the clip board"
"err_load_pgn" : "PGN chess history could not be loaded"
"pref_wakelock_desc" : "This will prevent your phone going to sleep"
"pref_onLoadJumpToLastMove_desc" : "When resuming the App, jump to the last move"
"pref_fullscreen_desc" : "Recommended for small screens and landscape view; elements may fall off the screen otherwise"

high.title: Application vulnerable to Janus Vulnerability
high.description: Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android 5.0-8.0, if signed only with v1 signature scheme. Applications running on Android 5.0-7.0 signed with v1, and v2/v3 scheme is also vulnerable.

warning.title: Application Data can be Backed up
warning.description:
[android:allowBackup] flag is missing.
The flag [android:allowBackup] should be set to false. By default it is set to true and allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.

warning.title: Content Provider (MyPGNProvider) is not Protected.
warning.description:
[[Content Provider, targetSdkVersion < 17]
A Content Provider is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. It is a Content Provider that targets an API level under 17, which makes it exported by default, regardless of the API level of the system that the application runs on.

warning.title: Content Provider (.puzzle.MyPuzzleProvider) is not Protected.
warning.description:
[[Content Provider, targetSdkVersion < 17]
A Content Provider is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. It is a Content Provider that targets an API level under 17, which makes it exported by default, regardless of the API level of the system that the application runs on.

App can read/write to External Storage. Any App can read data written to External Storage.
https://github.com/MobSF/owasp-mstg/blob/master/Document/0x05d-Testing-Data-Storage.md#external-storage

warning.title: App uses SQLite Database and execute raw SQL query. Untrusted user input in raw SQL queries can cause SQL Injection. Also sensitive information should be encrypted and written to the database.
warning.description:
App uses SQLite Database and execute raw SQL query. Untrusted user input in raw SQL queries can cause SQL Injection. Also sensitive information should be encrypted and written to the database.
https://github.com/MobSF/owasp-mstg/blob/master/Document/0x04h-Testing-Code-Quality.md#injection-flaws-mstg-arch-2-and-mstg-platform-2

secure.title: This application has no privacy trackers
secure.description: This application does not include any user or device trackers. Unable to find trackers during static analysis.

hotspot.title: Found 1 critical permission(s)
hotspot.description:
Ensure that these permissions are required by the application.

android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE (dangerous): read/modify/delete external storage contents - Allows an application to write to external storage.
